author: Zapp_Brannigan
title: Good
review: There is nothing special about this set, but I gave it a three because it works just fine in my city. There is one big problem, though. There should be a yellow solid line in the middle if they want to make it two way traffic, not a white dotted. Now they should move on to freeways and avenues.

author: meyerc13
title: Compatible with 7280 & 7281!
review:
A little over a year ago, I was lucky enough to stumble across an out of the way toy store that had some of these road plates new in package, for the original retail price!  My son didn't have any road plates, so at the time these were the first we purchased.  Lucky enough, I found out that these are compatible with the latest LEGO road plates at the time of this writing, sets 7280 and 7281.

Pros

  • As mentioned above, the best thing is that these are compatible with the current plates at the time of this writing.  The road is the same width, and the studded section is the same width, so everything lines up perfectly.
  • Another great thing is that these have a green studded area, which resembles grass.  This allows you to have more green in your City without being limited to 32 stud square green base plates.
  • The final advantage of these sets was the packaging.  If you need straight roads, you bought a package with two straight roads.  If you needed curves, you bought two curves.  You didn't end up with plates you couldn't use.

Cons

  • The only con is that these are no longer manufactured, so they can be difficult and expensive to find.

If you should happen to be as lucky as I was and stumble across these plates at a decent price, don't hesitate to buy them!
